reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel conveniently located on the square containing the Frauenkirche. I have no major complaints about our stay. We had a bit of a problem with the lock on our room that took a while to fix, but eventually it got taken care of. I noticed a slight decrease in the English proficiency at the front desk compared to other areas of Germany . Overall, not a bad experience. Great base for site seeing. Rooms were very nice. Expensive.
reviews.title: Good hotel for Dresden sight seeing.....
Great Experience
reviews.text: Outstanding hotel located directly across the street from the Frauenkirche. Comfortable atmosphere with modern amenities. Hotel is located within walking distance of all Old Town attractions.

My room was outstanding. It was a corner room overlooking the Elbe. The beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was modern and clean. Housekeeping staff put out special children's towels, children's bathrobe and rubber ducky for my 2 year old before we arrived. This was a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel! Happy to be here!

likes.liked: — Location, updated facilities, nice hotel with nice rooms

reviews.text: Front desk staff and porters were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. The porters especially went above and beyond to make my kids feel special. Pool area was very nice and pool was decent size.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel restaurants were surprisingly good and wait staff was very attentive.
reviews.title: What A Treasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location but limited to local shops. it is a nice style modern and simple hotel and made you feel pampered a bit. but it doesn't met the amount of money you pay especially you are pretty much isolated eating at their restaurants, but the sightseeing is all around you.
reviews.title: great location but too much money

reviews.text: My big problem, first. I'm probably the only traveler who doesn't have a laptop, and I must spend 1-2 hours a day connected to the Internet. The Dresden Hilton charges something like USD $20-25 per hour to use the PC in the business center, which I find price-gouging. Public Internet cafes in Dresden charge about 10% of that rate. Unfortunately, there are no Internet cafes anywhere close to the Hilton. The Swissotel in Berlin, at which I stayed prior to the Hilton, provides this service in its business center, for free. Because of this problem, I wouldn't stay at the Hilton again. However, the manager of the Hilton e-mailed me that they are trying to fix this by changing Internet providers.
reviews.title: Good Hotel With One Big Problem

likes.disliked: — Excessive charges for using the Internet.

reviews.text: Aside from this, which will not affect many others, the Hilton is a very good choice. It is located right in the middle of the old city, and I was able to walk to all of the major tourist sites. The room was relatively large and pleasant, and was filled with the amenities one would expect in this price range. The staff was exceptionally friendly, the breakfast excellent, and the atmosphere was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Functional, but disappointing.
Excellent hotel, great location
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton for 11 days at the end of October and was very disappointed. My room was clean and quiet--and for that I'm grateful. But I might as well have been in Kansas City. It was nothing like the marvelous experience I had at the Dresden Radisson Gewanthaus in March where the staff always greeted me, and were graciousness personified.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the Hilton housekeeping always forgot to replace something (shampoo, coffee, toilet paper) when they cleaned the room, but when I called to ask for a replacement, it was always brought promptly.
reviews.title: Great location & Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Car parking is 19 Euros per day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two night here during a month long trip to Central Europe. It was very tricky to find from the train station with luggage, partly because the front entrance was obscured by construction. Once we managed to locate the place, it was smooth sailing--got ungraded to an executive floor due to all of the soulless Hiltons I have stayed in on business trips. You can't beat the location, right in the pedestrian only core of the city. We never even had to figure out how to use the tram system, though it certainly looks modern and efficient. The breakfast buffet is standard chain hotel fare, and too pricey for what you end up eating.
reviews.title: Central location, efficient and comfortable

likes.liked: — Location in the center of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much in the way of charm here, but everything worked, everything was clean and comfortable, and you are steps from most everything you will want to see in Dresden.
reviews.title: Christmas in Dresden

likes.disliked: — Air conditioning is not powerful enough

reviews.text: Second visit to the Hilton in Dresden. We took the mother-in-law in July as well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and service
Perfect Location in Dresden
reviews.text: We love the central location, friendly staff , good restaurants (especially the Dampfschiff) and the leisure facilities.

We spent 6 nights over Christmas and had a magical stay. the Christmas markets are wonderful, the "gluhwein" flows and the sausages legendary. It's not a german Christmas without standing in the freezing cold with a mug of the hot mulled wine and a sausage dripping with mustard. We went to the opera to see the "Nutcracker" ballet and we could dash from the hotel in our fine clothes without having to get a taxi.
reviews.title: Location the best.. but too much SMOKE in main areas

likes.disliked: — Too much smoke in the common areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton in Dresden is just so central. The points of interest are all within a few minutes walk of the hotel.
reviews.title: Just so central

reviews.text: It is a chain hotel, which means what it lacks in charm it more than makes up in efficiency. This is a modern hotel in the old part of town. Everything worked extremely well. The rooms are not large but they were perfectly well equipped, comfortable and very functional.
reviews.title: well run-with a sense of style

reviews.text: The breakfast was one of the best encountered - the food was just so fresh and well presented. Service was attentive yet discrete. When requests were made they were handled politely and efficiently.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only grizzle was the cost of internet use - expensive. However, it would be unfair the drop the rating a notch on the strength of this.
reviews.title: Fabulous location!

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend Dresden as a place to visit and the Hilton as a place to stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous service at the Hiltonl
